Examples: American Univesity in Cairo and University of California
BMC Health Services Research, Nature Briefing and The Cairo Review
ABC News, AP News, BBC, Bloomberg, CNBC, Enterprise, Euronews, Frontiers, Reuters, The New Arab and Zawya

Source Category: Atalayar and News and analysis platform

Examples: Egypt Today, Fast Company, Foreign Policy, Fortune, The Africa Report and Time
Ahram Online, Asharq Al-Awsat, BNN, Daily News Egypt, Egyptian Streets, EU Observer, Financial Times, Mada Masr and The National News
MERIP, NPR and The Tahrir Institute
Arab Center Washington DC and The Swedish Institute of  International Affairs, UI
Atlantic Council, Carnegie Endowment and The Washington Institute for Near East Policy

Issues Definitions.Definition: The matrix is comprised of 3 dimensions/categories:Economic, Social & Environmental. These are the main umbrellas on which the assessment is based.
A dimension can be expressed by using a number of criteria or pillars. Each dimension is divided into 2-4 pillars.
Emerging issues of the month; no limit to the amount of issues to be included; title itself not to exceed 5 words.
The main source/s where the issue is mentioned and/or analysed (e.g The Guardian).
This would include the link corresponding to the analysis for each source (e.g. news article, social media post, website analysis, .. etc.)
Any notes related to data acquisition (e.g. data type, instructions about the template, .. etc.)
Includes the word dictionary (any words associated with the dictionary) and search terms (any terms to be used)
Includes the following pillars: Economic Development, Energy, Knowledge, innovation & scientific research, and Transparency & efficient government institutions.
Includes the following pillars: Social Justice, Health, Education & Training
Includes the following pillars: Environment, and Urban Development
